name: Bl. Lanfranc

locations.description: Prior and teacher at Bec Abbey

summary: Lanfranc was Archbishop of Canterbury from 1070 to 1089. He was an Italian Benedictine monk who became prior of Bec Abbey in Normandy, where he established a famous school. He was a teacher of Anselm of Canterbury and played a key role in the Norman reform of the English Church. He worked closely with William the Conqueror to reorganize the English Church along Norman lines. He is venerated as Blessed.
